Understanding the Tourist

This unit introduces student to the nature of contemporary tourists drawing on perspectives from psychology, sociology and anthropology. It considers definitions of the tourist and the different typologies of tourists. It examines theories of tourist motivation and the key influences on demand for, and participation in, tourism. It also examines the shift from mass to post-mass tourist experiences with attention to key types of post-mass tourists and tourism.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Understand definitions of the tourist and the various ways of classifying tourists.

+  Understand key theories of tourist motivation.

+  Understand the key factors which incluence tourist demand and participation.

+  Understand how the shift from mass to post-mass tourism has brought about changes in the behaviour and experiences of tourists.
